document.docAuthor: Li, Fan, Liao, Te-Yu, Arai, Ryoichi & Zhao, Liangjie
document.docTitle: Sinorhodeus Li & Liao & Arai & Zhao 2017, gen. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Sinorhodeus microlepis, a new genus and species of bitterling from China (Teleostei: Cyprinidae: Acheilognathinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Sinorhodeus microlepis, a new genus and species of bitterling from China (Teleostei: Cyprinidae: Acheilognathinae)

heading.emphasis:
Sinorhodeus
gen. nov. Li, Liao & Arai

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Sinorhodeus
can be distinguished from all other genera of Acheilognathinae by the following characters: pharyngeal teeth 0,0,4–4,0,0, longitudinal scales 41–46, transverse scales 16–18, white spots on dorsalfin rays absent, a black blotch on dorsal fin in juvenile absent, less developed wing-like yolk sac projections in larvae. Similar to
Rhodeus
in absence of barbels and incomplete lateral line, but distinguished from it by absence of white spots on dorsal-fin rays (vs. present), absence of a black blotch on dorsal fin in juvenile (vs. present), and less developed wing-like yolk sac projections in larvae (vs. well developed, Fig. 1A ). Similar to
Tanakia
sensu lato (
Tanakia
,
Paratanakia
, and
Pseudorhodeus
) in absence of white spots on dorsal-fin rays, absence of a black blotch b b ! "! "# "!

Danio dangila
7 82 11 &1 (9&0&.0/ (9320..2 (9320..& (9320/&3 (9320/1. (9320/­­ et al. &2 3
Nipponocypris sieboldii
7 822­.1 (9&0&/,: 0/2.0,: 0/ &2,:1 &­,:1 &,:1 3 et al. &2 3 on dorsal fin in juvenile, and less developed wing-like yolk sac projections in larvae ( Fig. 1B ), but distinguished from them by uninterrupted incomplete lateral line (vs. complete in
Tanakia
and
Paratanakia
, interrupted incomplete in
Pseudorhodeus
) and absence of barbels (vs. present). Distinguished from
Acheilognathus
by incomplete lateral line (vs. complete, except
A. typus
with incomplete lateral line), absence of white spots on finrays of dorsal fin (vs. present), and less developed wing-like yolk sac projections in larvae (vs. not developed, Fig. 1C ).
Sinorhodeus
also can be further distinguished from all other genera by fewer pharyngeal teeth (0,0,4–4,0,0 vs. 0,0,5–5,0,0) ( Table 3 ).

caption.paragraph: TABLE 2. Models applied for each codon of seven genes. Numbers refer to codon positions. Refer to Table 1 for abbreviations of genes.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 3. Diagnoses of six genera of the subfamily Acheilognathinae .

tr.th: Whitish spots on fin-rays of dorsal fin form two transverse bands
A black blotch on dorsal fin

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The generic name,
Sinorhodeus
, is derived from the Latin Sino , meaning "Chinese", and
Rhodeus
, a genus of bitterling fish, in reference to its distribution in China and morphological similarity to
Rhodeus
. The gender is masculine.
